body:
The server that hosts the models resides in Amsterdam and I just ran `bash download.bash` on a server on the west coast of the United States and got the following.

```
--2019-12-28 12:23:53--  http://content.sniklaus.com/github/pytorch-liteflownet/network-default.pytorch
Resolving content.sniklaus.com (content.sniklaus.com)... 51.15.58.24
Connecting to content.sniklaus.com (content.sniklaus.com)|51.15.58.24|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 21576446 (21M) [application/octet-stream]
Saving to: ‘network-default.pytorch’

network-default.pytorch            100%[================================================================>]  20.58M  3.83MB/s    in 21s     

2019-12-28 12:24:14 (1002 KB/s) - ‘network-default.pytorch’ saved [21576446/21576446]

--2019-12-28 12:24:14--  http://content.sniklaus.com/github/pytorch-liteflownet/network-kitti.pytorch
Resolving content.sniklaus.com (content.sniklaus.com)... 51.15.58.24
Connecting to content.sniklaus.com (content.sniklaus.com)|51.15.58.24|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 21576446 (21M) [application/octet-stream]
Saving to: ‘network-kitti.pytorch’

network-kitti.pytorch              100%[================================================================>]  20.58M  3.84MB/s    in 15s     

2019-12-28 12:24:30 (1.35 MB/s) - ‘network-kitti.pytorch’ saved [21576446/21576446]

--2019-12-28 12:24:30--  http://content.sniklaus.com/github/pytorch-liteflownet/network-sintel.pytorch
Resolving content.sniklaus.com (content.sniklaus.com)... 51.15.58.24
Connecting to content.sniklaus.com (content.sniklaus.com)|51.15.58.24|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 21576446 (21M) [application/octet-stream]
Saving to: ‘network-sintel.pytorch’

network-sintel.pytorch             100%[================================================================>]  20.58M  3.99MB/s    in 15s     

2019-12-28 12:24:45 (1.36 MB/s) - ‘network-sintel.pytorch’ saved [21576446/21576446]
```

There are no obvious issues on my end, maybe it was a temporary networking issue? Closing for now.
